abstract: National Weather Service is predicting up to two inches of snow in parts of New York's Adirondack mountains and in Green Mountains of Vermont, unusual occurrence for June.

headline.print_headline: June Skiing in Adirondacks? No, but Snow Is Forecast
headline.main: Snow in June? It’s Forecast for the Adirondacks

snippet: The higher peaks in northern New York, along with the Green Mountains in Vermont, are expecting up to two inches on Wednesday night into Thursday. This weather is unusual, but not unheard-of.
lead_paragraph: The higher peaks in northern New York, along with the Green Mountains in Vermont, are expecting up to two inches on Wednesday night into Thursday. This weather is unusual, but not unheard-of.
